author: {'steamid': '76561197981638563', 'num_games_owned': 4007, 'num_reviews': 518, 'playtime_forever': 2004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2002, 'last_played': 1579465619}
review:
Because of some really weird coincidence, I'm getting way too many mobile games in [b]Steam[/b] lately. Here comes another one. Unlike many others, though, this one is pretty cool. And I'm not saying that because I'm a [i]huge[/i] fan of historical games about ancient [b]Egypt[/b] (if we can call such games historical with the entire Egyptian history being pretty much a fiction). It's just... it's a pretty cute and addicting game, really.

Long story short, it's a very casual take on grand strategy genre with you dragging and dropping the icons of your workers on different regions of the map being most of gameplay. It sounds simple and, well, it sure is, but like any other good casual game, this one adds just enough complications to make it interesting, while keeping things simple. You'll be able to praise the gods, there'll be trials, you'll be able to build stuff, there'll be simplified combat and so on. The game also won't push you and will let you to choose how to approach the other tribes. In other words, you'll be able to both unite with them peacefully, or kick their buts and see them suffer. Your choice. Naturally, the entire thing is laughably historically incorrect, but again, what is? I mean, when the [b]Impressions Games[/b] created [b]Pharaoh[/b] (one of the very best games about ancient [b]Egypt[/b], go and buy it now if you still didn't), the â€œhistoryâ€ tried to tell us that pyramids were built by slaves. Then [i]boom![/i] â€œHistoryâ€ changed its opinion. So... yeah. Don't think too much about the accuracy, just enjoy the overall atmosphere.

No a couple of words about the bad stuff. The worst thing about this game is that there's no campaign. There's no story, there's no set of pre-made missions with certain goals, there's nothing like that. In other words, â€œfree play modeâ€ is the only mode you get here. And with the price tag being [b]$9.99[/b] / [b]Â£6.99[/b]... you may actually expect a little bit more than that.

Like I've said, though, this game is seriously addicting. Simple, yet â€œsmartâ€ gameplay and comfortable [b]UI[/b] make it a really nice alternative to your usual workplace entertainment. As the result, you may end up wasting way more time on this game than you've expected. So... the price may not be as bad after all. It may be a better idea to get this game for you mobile device, just because it's something you probably won't want to play on your huge [b]8K[/b] TV, but even in [b]Steam[/b], I'd say that it's a pretty nice purchase. As long as ultra-casual (yet not dumb) strategy is what you need.

review: There isn't much of a tutorial, but the game is not very hard to learn to play.  Its replay value is somewhat limited because the events are scripted, and you can't get a good score without having a sense from prior games of when to use all your resources and when to stockpile them.  However, this game is very low cost and a huge amount of fun.  On sale for $3, it is a great bargain, and its not a bad deal at full price.

review:
Ce jeu est plaisant, ses objectifs sont clairs et offre une difficultÃ© intÃ©ressante pour toutes personnes compÃ©titives (comme moi). MalgrÃ© le fait qu'il commence de la mÃªme maniÃ¨re qu'importe les parties, je trouve Ã§a tout de mÃªme divertissant, car je suis plus en mesure de gÃ©rer la construction de ma ville en fonction des circonstances et des Ã©vÃ©nements. 

Si vous espÃ©rez un jeu qui dure longtemps, ce n'est pas celui-ci qu'il faudra choisir. Cependant, pour un jeu payÃ© si peu cher, je trouve qu'il rentabilise bien le temps et qu'il est intÃ©ressant. Niveau historique, j'ai trouvÃ© les informations intÃ©ressantes, cela me servira sans doute Ã©ventuellement dans un rpg sur table ! 

J'ai bien aimÃ© le fait que le jeu est une dÃ©mo. Je l'ai installÃ© et essayÃ© avant de l'acheter. Si vous n'Ãªtes pas certain de votre achat, je vous suggÃ¨re donc d'essayer :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198021034964', 'num_games_owned': 852, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1597130133}
review: Fun, easy to learn game. Can be beaten in one sitting. Start with a small settlement and expand until you rule the whole of Egypt. Use force or diplomacy to deal with neighboring tribes, conduct research and pray to gods, build temples and monuments and learn about the ancient Egyptian lifestyle in the process.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003147021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1598774628}
review:
If you're _really_ bored and want something you can play in windowed mode for an afternoon, this isn't a bad little game if you can grab it for under a few bucks. Once you learn a build order, you've learned the game, and there's absolutely no replay value whatsoever.

It's a "meh" game, and I'd feel bad giving it a thumbs down, so I guess it gets a thumbs up, again, only if you can get it for _cheap_.

review: Ich habe Predynastic Egypt als â€œMini-Civâ€œ fÃ¼r meinen schwachen Laptop gekauft und wurde nicht enttÃ¤uscht. PE ist ein simplizistisches Worker Placement-Spiel in der angenehmer, schnÃ¶rkelloser Optik, die an Ã¤gyptischen Papyrus und Sandstein angelehnt ist. Jede Runde bilde ich neue Arbeiter aus, erkunde den Nil und nutze die neu entdeckten Gebiete als Ressourcenfelder. Krieg gibt es nur als MenÃ¼, Armeen sind eine Ressource, was mir als Freund von Wirtschafts-, aber nicht von Kriegssimulationen sehr gefÃ¤llt. PE folgt einer lose an die Geschichte des vordynastischen Ã„gyptens angelehnten ErzÃ¤hlung, zwischen zahlreichen zufÃ¤lligen Events passieren also regelmÃ¤ÃŸig feste Challenges, die bei Erreichen in einer von drei Stufen (Gold, Silber, Bronze) zur Vereinigung Reichs Ã„gypten fÃ¼hren. Hier Ã¼berall Gold zu erreichen und Ã„gypten auf unterschiedliche Arten zu vereinen gibt mir viel Wiederspielwert, und bei 3h fÃ¼r meine erste Runde bin ich sehr zufrieden mit dem Pacing des Spiels. GÃ¼nstig und gut, lÃ¤uft auf jedem Toaster, ein gutes Spiel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198069365393', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1605854144}
review: A good little game, cheap and on sale a lot, it provides a nice, relaxing few hours of content, and if you like ancient civilization, Egypt or farming, it's right up your ally. Only a few downsides, one being that in my first game I stayed in the city map for a long time, when I should have been expanding into Egypt, forgetting there is a time limit, which sucks. Another is the odd UI, which is good and bad, and takes a little while to get used to. The music was better than expected, this was a great game to play after taking a college class on Ancient Egypt, as is the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097706533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 1574038615}
review:
Small and simple game, with simple strategy within. But heavily dependent on random events (especially on high difficulty). Sometimes feels like graphical implementation of "random" events. Main goal is to move your "workers" cards on different tiles to get most "returns" in required resources. 
Game was very smooth. I didn't face any bug or problem within.
Players who like casual games - would like it. Players who expect detailed strategy or want to challenge themself (like I'm) - would not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299984706', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1572547837}
review: Events are too random for my taste. They sometimes make no sense. Very annoying. I don't even know how this game got into my inventory but I gave it a try. It was waste of the time.
developer_response: We tried to make the events random enough to make it interesting to replay, but nonetheless that they would not change the historical outline of what is happening. Because First of all, we tried to stay within the framework of historicity and the Soviet expert about this with learned Egyptologists.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977250280', 'num_games_owned': 578, 'num_reviews': 318, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1560181363}
review:
A surprisingly engaging and fun strategy game that keeps you going much longer than you though it could.
Nice stylised graphics and intuitive gameplay, it's quick to learn but hard to master, a sign of any well designed game.
Achievements are fun to get and the game is very heavily geared towards min/maxing which should appeal to a lot of players out there.
The history elements are also fun.
A very good casual game

review: Extremely fun the 6-7 hours the game lasts. If you get it on sale, like I did, there is a tremendous value for money here. When you've played the game 3 times, there ain't that much more to do (except trying for some achievements), but I didn't think that was a problem at all. Well worth a buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198169852770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1567122266}
review:
This game is VERY over-priced for what it offers. There is next to nothing for a tutorial and by the time you figure out what your supposed to be doing the Steam return policy has expired and your stuck with it.
The game is nothing more than moving Icon cards to locations and waiting for tech unlocks that for the most part don't seem to change much of anything. This game is like playing a spread-sheet...BORING!
It reminds me of some crap educational game you would find in some school. There is next to nothing to do! 
Boring game and overpriced!
developer_response: It is not clear how you fit the word "stupid" and "educational" together. Are you sure you used them correctly? We tried to make learning interesting and attractive! Itâ€™s sad that you didnâ€™t like it. We chose the price for our game according to the voting results among our players! The players themselves recommended this price to us.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982567490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1567725542}
review: This is a game about running an empire, with an extreme emphasis on screwing you over with special events without warning. It's not as good as it looks.
developer_response: We tried to convey the amosphere in which the ancient Egyptians existed, and no one warned them of future misfortunes either! And our game suggests that in order to master all the tests for the highest award, you need to go through it several times! Try and you will succeed!

review:
Aufgabe ist es, die Geschichte des Pre-historischen Ã„gyptens nachzuspielen. Man bekommt dementsprechend Aufgaben, die man zu erfÃ¼llen hat. Diese muss man in einer gewissen Zeit erfÃ¼llen bzw. es wird gefragt sie nach einer Anzahl Runden zu meistern.

Mein Motiv, weshalb ich dieses Spiel gekauft habe:
Als Gelegenheitsspiel fÃ¼r mich gedacht.
Meine Faszination zum alten Ã„gypten wieder auffrischen.

Nach einem ersten Spieldurchlauf, meine erste Reflektion zu diesem Spiel:

Die Geschichte ist tatsÃ¤chlich historisch 'korrekt' soweit ich mir dessen bewusst bin. Meine BÃ¼cher zu diesem Thema habe ich zwischendurch noch nebenbei aufgeschlagen, um historische Fakten nachzulesen. Ich bin kein Vollzeit Gamer und weiÃŸ daher nicht, ob es daran liegt oder ich einfach ein richtig schlechter Stratege bin: Ich fand es schon ziemlich schwer die Aufgaben zu meistern. Auch wenn ich nicht primÃ¤r auf das Gewinnen aus bin, hat es mich doch ein wenig frustriert. 

Weiterer Wehmutstropfen: Die Grafik ist sehr schlicht, was mich nicht stÃ¶rt. Ich habe sowieso ne alte Kiste. Ein wenig mehr Ã„sthetik im Spiel hÃ¤tte ich mir doch gewÃ¼nscht. Irgendwie fehlte mir etwas bei der Gestaltung des Spieles.

Fazit: Ich habe mein Wissen Ã¼ber das Alte Ã„gypten etwas auffrischen kÃ¶nnen. Es hat mir wirklich SpaÃŸ gemacht mit dem Hintergrund, dass es mir vor allem um die Geschichte ging.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169236206', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1595090135}
review:
Nice little informative game that can potentially teach you a lot, if you are not already into egyptian, or just general history.


Though it's a bit on the short side, and given the fact that it's the same map, with the same challenges, and not much of a way in interaction, aside from choosing your priorities, an your approach to other tribes, it is still very enjoyable, and I wholly recommend it for a try, especially if it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 814, 'last_played': 1574526521}
review:
"Predynastic Egypt" ist ein rundenbasiertes historisches Strategiespiel.

Die vordynastische Zeit Ã„gyptens. Wir bbefinden uns in einer Zeit, die 5000 bis 6000 Jahre zurÃ¼ckliegt. Bevor Ã¼berhaupt im Jahre 3032 v. Chr. mit den ersten Pharaonen die erste Dynastie begann.

In dieser FrÃ¼hzeit geht es oftmals ums Ãœberleben des eigenen Stammes, um Ausbreitung und Entwicklung. RevolutionÃ¤re Neuerungen in der Landwirtschaft und der Verwaltung machten das Wachstum erst mÃ¶glich, das nÃ¶tig war, um sich in den fruchtbaren Ebenen des Nils auszubreiten. Als Endpunkt dieser Entwicklung gilt die GrÃ¼ndung des ersten Ã¤gyptischen Staates, die dann in die lange und erfolgreiche Periode der Dynastien mÃ¼ndete.

Das Spiel hÃ¤lt sich eng an die historische Entwicklung. Man spielt auf der Karte des historisch fruchtbaren Ã„gyptens, hat zunÃ¤chst viel Fog of War um sich, entdeckt neue Gebiete, baut Strukturen aus, lernt neue Technologien wie etwa die Domestizierung von Tieren. Wilde StÃ¤mme kÃ¶nnen in die eigene Kultur integriert werden, Gegner kÃ¶nnen angegriffen werden, neue GebÃ¤ude kÃ¶nnen gebaut werden. Hauptziel ist es, sich in einer begrenzten Rundenzahl so weit auszubreiten und die gegnerischen StÃ¤mme soweit zu integrieren, daÃŸ die Konsequenz der StaatsgrÃ¼ndung unausweichlich wird.

Das Spiel erinnert ein wenig an ein Brettspiel, ein reduziertes Civilization in der Ausbreitungsphase. Dabei macht es aber nicht den Fehler wie Civ, ahistorisch zunÃ¤chst nahezu unproblematische Expansion zu ermÃ¶glichen. Viele Fortschritte beinhalten auch schwierige, unangenehme und unvermeidbare Konsequenzen. Die Entwicklung eines neuen Kultes etwa wird bei unserer BevÃ¶lkerung nicht ohne Widerspruch ablaufen. 

Und so sind wir denn immer wieder am AbwÃ¤gen, welche Entwicklung denn gerade die passendere ist, ob wir expandieren oder doch unsere GebÃ¤ude ausbauen. Die Nahrung begrenzt die BevÃ¶lkerungsanzahl. Wir kÃ¶nnen mehr BevÃ¶lkerung haben, allerdings nur unter Erleidung einiger Mali.

Das Spiel folgt eng der historisch realen Entwicklung, bietet deswegen nicht endlos viele Freiheiten. Eine Partie wird immer Ã¤hnlich verlaufen, mit unterschiedlichen Gewichtungen. Auch gibt es nur diese eine Karte. Der Wiederspielwert ist also recht gering.

Der Spielwert an sich ist dafÃ¼r umso hÃ¶her. Das Spiel glÃ¤nzt mit historischen Akkuratesse, hervorragend recherchierten historischen Fakten, allesamt wissenschaftlich fundiert. Und so ist auch die Aufmachung, die Grafik liebevoll an altÃ¤gyptische Wandzeichnungen angelehnt. 

Trotz der nicht allzu groÃŸen KomplexitÃ¤t des Spielsystems hat man das GefÃ¼hl, Historie und damit Wahrheit nachzuspielen und mitzuerleben. Das macht das Spielerlebnis einzigartig, besonders, erstaunlich unterhaltsam und faszinierend.

Trotz geringer Spielzeit und geringem Widerspielwert: die eine Partie "Predynastic Egypt" macht unglaublich viel SpaÃŸ, ist ein lehrreiches Erlebnis und wird einem lange im GedÃ¤chtnis bleiben. 

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
9/10 AtmosphÃ¤re
10/10 Story
8/10 Grafik
7/10 Sound
7/10 Spielmechanik
7/10 Balancing
9/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Faszinierende historische Exkursion.

[h1][b]9/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198008181404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 46918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23364, 'last_played': 1707638006}
review: Very simple and easy to pick up game.  Difficult to figure out what resources are important when first playing, but exploring how the game works and playing it multiple times will appeal to perfectionists.  negative events are very random and could happen every few turns and repeat.  A few games had to be abandoned because negative events damaging my buildings happened way too many times or combination of raids and rebellions with the revenge of the nubians can end game suddenly.  Otherwise this game is very easy to learn.  Remember focus on getting better trade is the easiest way to get rich especially late game.  Also, personally the max difficulty is not fun especially poor resources difficulty.  Setting difficulty to max but having plentiful resources can be challenging but probably the best difficulty to play on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024139194', 'num_games_owned': 2761, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5728, 'last_played': 1603638598}
review:
Facil de aprender, dificil de dominar.
BÃ sicamente es un juego de estrategia por turnos, una version minimalista de un civ con un historia ya pre establecida. El objetivo del juego administrar de mejor forma tus recursos para finalizar el juego con el mayor puntaje posible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030192100', 'num_games_owned': 1993, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1580642365}
review: I was pleasantly surprised by the game. One hand, it's based firmly in the history, on the other hand, you have enough freedom to choose your own path. Basic premise is that you start as a small tribe, create first settlement and start carving out kingdom, while inventing or discovering new things along the way. Not overtly long game either, so it's easy enough to start and finish one without sinking weeks of time in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028340785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1602709650}
review: Great game. The main flow of the story stays more or less the same, as in, the same things happen in the same turn each playthrough. So you gotta stay ahead of the curve, and that's quite rewarding. Also filled with a lot of historical info, pretty immersive. Well done!

author: {'steamid': '76561198154957188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1686795858}
review:
One of the highest compliments I can give to any game is that I have immediately replayed this after reaching the end, multiple times now. For fans of Civilization-type resource management games who also like ancient Egypt, this is the game for you. It's also fun and challenging to try to get all the Steam achievements in addition to the Gold victories for the various trials and missions.

You may need to play through a couple times before winning, but once you know what you have to do it gets easier. Then you can try to be the Best. :) Right now it takes me around 3 hours (?) or so to reach the end of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998455758', 'num_games_owned': 1566, 'num_reviews': 1960, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1612224180}
review: Step-by-step strategy for the development of the settlement. It is noteworthy that we start for a couple of families, but the power is constantly growing and in the end under our control is all of Egypt. Unfortunately, it is too linear and different passages will hardly differ from each other. Unlike good strategies, here for each problem there is exactly one optimal solution and if you didnâ€™t guess it, then you start to lag behind in development and risk not to pass in the allotted time.
developer_response: It's very sad that you didn't like our approach to building the gameplay, we wanted to bring something new to this genre and show your individuality, and you just want us to be like everyone else. We are well aware that our games are not suitable for everyone, but you don't seem to understand our main goal of making learning accessible and enjoyable. Have a nice day!

author: {'steamid': '76561197966590737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1560708612}
review: Very nice little strategy game that plays a lot like a board game, with an emphasis on the history and timeline of predynastic Egypt. It's not as deep as a 4X but mechanics-wise it goes along those lines, with a more story-driven scope and randomised events. I had never heard of the game or the developer and I'm really impressed with this game, it manages to cover many great bits of bigger strategy and management games, condensing it in a short to play envelope, and presented in a historically accurate manner. Loved it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030905002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 8821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8820, 'last_played': 1622366281}
review:
This is one of the better resource management games. The game play is constrained through a fairly tight decision tree.

The challenges are:
1. Resource allocation - you cannot set and forget. You are obsessing over worker placements every turn.
2. Exploration - the whole map is not necessary, but there is a bonus for doing so.
3. Trade or conquest. Sometimes trade is far better for getting resources.

The combat system is very simple. The side with the most troops wins.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090560515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1560148508}
review:
I can tell what this game was "trying" to be, but it didn't accomplish it's intended purpose. 
The game is "technically" broken because you have to do some very specific things, in a very specific order, and unless you're psychic (sometimes you have to skip ahead/tech tree). You CANNOT beat the game. It's ridiculous, in that, instead of being entertaining or difficult, it contrives missions that take the enjoyment away and replace it with interruptions and cheating (on the AI's part). The game has potential, but only just, and it's already fully developed so there's no saving it.
developer_response:
Hello!
Let me respond to your unfair comment.
The game does not require you to be a psychic, just our games are built in such a way that they are designed for the fact that for a successful passage to the best result you need to make several attempts and learn a lesson in history, because our game is based on real events and the real history of ancient Egypt. That's all. It is a pity that you did not catch such a simple idea of our project, but we understand that not all people are ready to learn even in the form of a game, and most are just looking for easy entertainment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200213851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1582168830}
review: Those people who have complained about the game seem to be missing the point.  I am awful at videogames and even I could do pretty well in this, so it aint what I'd call difficult, but in the same token challenge and clever tactics are not really what you're there for.  The game is, boiling it down, an education tool, like a browser game that you find on sites like discovery kids' website (If that's still around), but with much better production values and presumably more accurate.  For this purpose, as a person who has always been interested in egyptian history and mythology, both Predynastic Egypt and the sequel, Egypt Old Kingdom, come highly reccomended to fellow egypt enthusiasts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008834011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1559655960}
review: Nice worker placement game.  It's not a 4X, and heavily scripted (to follow actual history).  Takes 4 hours to play through once.  I've done that and will play it through again at some point in the future but am pretty happy with what I've had.  Shame you can't zoom out much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198824850087', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1556816030}
review:
Besides being a fun strategy game, this is like an interactive history simulator. You can tell a lot of research went into this. From all the different events, to technological advancements, belief system, trials and even recreating the actual city of Hierakonpolis. The game follows history very closely. You're not just playing, you're learning about one of the most mysterious civilizations to have ever existed.

This is complemented with nice sounds, like wind, rain or birds chirping in the background. Soft colors with beautifull art, and only a handfull of resources to manage. Making the entire experience very relaxing. 

While the game is easy to learn, it's hard to master. That's because it's based around a score system. For every key trial you complete, you'll get a score ranging from +1 (Bronze) to +3 (Gold). There are also several difficulty starting options which affect your score. If you successfully finish the game, you'll get your final score, obviously. Besides the nice experience the game offers, the score system will also have you coming back. Believe me, that max score is really, really difficult to get. There are also a lot of achievements to hunt for, tied to these trials and scores for extra incentive. So, there is enough replayability here. While the game is on the short side, with a playthrough only lasting about 1,5 hours, you'll easily get your money's worth out of it.

Hardcore strategy fans might find this game a bit casual (besides going for the max score), but it's the nature of this game that sets it apart from others. It's a relaxing history simulator and it excells at it. 

I highly recommend this game to fans of Ancient Egypt or strategy fans in general. It'd also make for a nice gift for anyone in your circle with an interest in this civilization.

I give this game a 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198007745585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1223, 'last_played': 1681935602}
review:
Summary: Surprising amount of depth, meaningful choices, but you'll make lots of mistakes the first playthrough. 

I'm a huge fan of Egypt (played Pharaoh and Rome Total War as Egypt a lot as a kid) and when I saw this game, I wasn't expecting a lot beyond fun history and charming artwork. What a surprise I got! This Civ-like game has a lot of choices for the player, including what techs to prioritize, what cults to invoke, what buildings to build first, and whether you want to develop trade, peaceful unification, or outright conquest of your neighbors. 
In addition to growing your town (soon chiefdom, empire), there are a series of "trials" that move the gameplay along, presenting a challenge within a set turn limit for the player. The sooner you do it, the bigger your bonuses can be! 
There's a lot of historical flavor to the game as well, since the game confines itself to the Predynastic period of Egyptian history the techs can be very specific, presenting little history lessons that contribute to an immersive feel. Random events also contribute to this historical feel, as do the player's choices during "trials."
One criticism I have seen on the discussion boards is that knowing what the next challenge is going to be ahead of time is a necessity, and for a min-maxing player I would agree. For example, in my last playthrough I got held up at the end because I hadn't yet explored the Sinai. Because I could only hurry up the scouting so much, I was late developing Sinai-specific buildings, which derailed my end-game somewhat. BUT it didn't prevent me from winning, and that's the reply I would give to that type of criticism. You certainly can look up walkthroughs or "game schedules" and know exactly how to prepare for the next challenge to get the best score, but you don't have to have an optimal score to have a great time. Even though I scored better on my most recent playthrough, I enjoyed my first one the most, not knowing what was around the bend and discovering challenges for the first time alongside my citizens. 
Overall, if you like civilization-building, Egyptian history, and a more relaxed, turn-based play style, this game has a lot to offer you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006963719', 'num_games_owned': 10074, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1554902829}
review: Predynastic Egypt is a very nice strategy/management game that is easy to learn, but hard to master. The historic aspect is well done, the game is satisfying to play and requires future-planning in order to be successful. I can gladly recommend to grab it during a sale if the description above fits your expectations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198825010795', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1554232584}
review:
Predynastic Egypt is one of the biggest disappointments I have ever had. Don't let the videos and pictures decieve you, don't let it trick you to but this strategy-looking-like puzzle game.

First of all, it has almost nothing to do with strategy because everything is under your control if you are smart enough to get its cheesy gameplay mechanics. Secondly, it has the worst tech tree a game can have, I mean it's not even a tech tree and nothing really matters here, one way or another you get to win the game at the end, no matter what. Thirdly, this game the fusion of words "boring" and "repetitive". I mean couldn't they at least try for multiplayer to make it a bit interesting? I guess no.

So this game doesn't worth a single penny, even with if there will be a 99% discount, I still won't recommend this game. This game is no better than those early 2000s flash games. Actually, those games were better than this "thing". I'm warning you, don't make the mistake, unless you're a 7 year old child who just wants to "chill".
developer_response:
Hello, Mtanoes! 
It's sad to get such a feedback. We have not tried to deceive or mislead anyone. You forget about the important aspect of our game, namely about its historical part. Our game is primarily educational in nature, allowing you to explore the history of ancient Hierakonpolis and history to the dynastic Egypt. We are very sorry that our game seemed boring to you, we tried to add to it interesting mechanics allowing players to make important decisions. The game is designed for players of all ages and skills. We tried to make it simple and interesting for everyone, so maybe for such experienced players as you the game may not seem interesting, but you should not be so selfish. After all, we tried to make sure that even 7-year-old children could play our game and not only have fun, but also get real historical knowledge at the same time. Sadly, instead of supporting our development educational game projects, we get only cries about the games must only entertain.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110977352', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1554065045}
review:
This is not at all the kind of game I typically play. Picked it up as part of the [i]Clarus Victoria Bundle[/i] since that wasn't much more than [i]Egypt: Old Kingdom[/i] on its own. I didn't have any interest in this one, but I figured I'd try it out before [i]Old Kingdom[/i], and I'm glad I did. I've enjoyed it.

Going into a little more detail: 
It's pretty linear since it's structured around a number of key social or economic developments. Yet it's been surprisingly replayable. Resources and other tribes are found in roughly the same places, but the random events that pop up from time to time and the basic decisions you make every turn help make each playthrough feel a bit different from the ones before. Even starting from the same save three times, I wound up in three different kinds of trouble. Simply knowing a major event is approaching doesn't necessarily mean you're prepared to tackle it. I've made it to the end a bunch of times now, but have yet to complete all the victory conditions and truly win the game.

It doesn't take more than a couple hours to go from beginning to end which is nice - when I fail, it doesn't feel like I wasted a bunch of time. There's also a convenient save feature so you can pick it up, play a bit, and put it down again. All the current challenges and events are listed in plain view so it's very easy to pick up right where you left off. 

The interface is basic but looks and sounds good. Management is very simple: workers, food, production, army, culture, and authority, but juggling them along with events can pose a bit of a challenge. I'll probably get at least 15-20 hours out of it on the Historical settings, and there's another pair of settings - one easier, and one more difficult, all of which can be mixed and matched to customize a playthrough however you wish.

review:

Overall I like it and probably will keep playing it to get the 33/33

author: {'steamid': '76561198412526031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1678, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1516, 'last_played': 1705158320}
review:
Bist Du imstande, in diesem rundenbasierten Strategiespiel aus Hierakonpolis eine mÃ¤chtige Stadt zu formen, das prÃ¤dynastische Ã„gypten zu vereinen und an die Schwelle zum Alten Reich zu fÃ¼hren? Kluges Worker-Placement und durchdachtes Ressourcenmanagement sind dabei der entscheidende SchlÃ¼ssel zum Erfolg; ebenso verbessert man die Stadt durch zahlreiche Bauten und erforscht verschiedene Technologien. Obwohl diese Entwicklung im Innern einen besonders wichtigen Teil des Spiels ausmacht, muss man sich auch mit den lieben Nachbarn auseinandersetzen und sie kriegerisch oder diplomatisch â€Ã¼berzeugenâ€œ. Und wenn alles schiefzugehen droht, kann man immer noch die HÃ¤nde gen Himmel heben und die GÃ¶tter um Beistand bitten, die dann helfend eingreifen.

Dank der intensiven Zusammenarbeit mit Historikern ist Predynastic Egypt historisch nicht nur besonders gut recherchiert, sondern lÃ¤sst den Spieler fÃ¼r ein paar Stunden in gewisser Weise wirklich das Alte Ã„gypten nacherleben (eine passende Grafik und liebevoll ausgesuchter Soundtrack verstÃ¤rken diesen Eindruck): Als Herrscher steht man vor entscheidenden Herausforderungen der damaligen Lebenswelt und muss die richtige Antwort finden â€“ nicht immer mag dies einfach sein, manchmal scheitert man bei bestimmten PrÃ¼fungen in den ersten AnlÃ¤ufen. Jede Challenge findet aber sicherlich einmal die passende Response :-) 

Gerade dieses enge Anlehnen an die geschichtliche Entwicklung macht den besonderen Charakter dieses Spiels aus: Es ist das pure Gegenteil eines Sandboxspiels, sondern folgt als lineares Spiel einem starken Skriptum. So sind etwa die PrÃ¼fungen stets dieselben, und eigentlich gibt es meist nur einen einzigen wirklich perfekten LÃ¶sungsweg. Verglichen mit dem diesbezÃ¼glich liberaleren Nachfolgespiel â€Egypt: Old Kingdomâ€œ sorgt dies fÃ¼r etwas weniger Wiederspielwert. Da die PrÃ¼fungen auf den hÃ¶heren Schwierigkeitsstufen durchaus anspruchsvoller sind, bietet das Spiel dennoch viel Motivation, die eigene Punktezahl hÃ¶her zu schrauben und dieses oder jenes Achievement doch noch zu knacken.

Insgesamt kann ich dieses Spiel allen wÃ¤rmstens empfehlen, die ein Ã¤uÃŸerst liebevoll umgesetztes Strategiespiel mit thematischem Schwerpunkt schÃ¤tzen und gerne fÃ¼r ein paar Stunden eine Zeitreise ins Alte Ã„gypten unternehmen wollen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173459466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 631, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1551089103}
review:
If you like Ancient History, especially Ancient Egypt and it's mythology, you'll like this game!
The gameplay is pretty straight-forward, but the lore and the events you encounter shake it up and give you insight into how life could've been in those days. 
I found it very enjoyable, and it has a great replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085979609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 295, 'last_played': 1549633252}
review:
Predynastic Egypt es un juego de estrategia por turnos en la que debemos llevar nuestra tribu egipcia a la gloria del primer reino predinÃ¡stico egipcio. Es un juego simple pero entretenido. Principalmente nuestro objetivo es administrar recursos y tomar decisiones en diferentes eventos, siendo algunos aleatorios como otros ya prefijados. Existen diferentes metas dentro de la partida que nos darÃ¡n bonificaciones para alcanzar la meta final.

Posee sÃ³lo un escenario pero las condiciones de comienzo pueden ser modificadas para cambiar un poco el ritmo del juego. El escenario puede tomar entre unas 3 a 5 horas en completar. Recomendado para pasar un buen rato y de yapa aprender algo de historia sobre el Antiguo Egipto.

Recomendado!

author: {'steamid': '76561197988895320', 'num_games_owned': 940, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1546873140}
review:
Basically a dumbed down version of Civilization. Takes 30-60 minutes for a game. Fairly simple and easy learning curve. 
Got it on sale for ~4â‚¬ and I feel it's worth that amount. 10â‚¬ is stretching even though I don't have any issues with the game. Just feels very easy and as far as I understand there's only one map

author: {'steamid': '76561198011436266', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1577900618}
review:
This game managed to satisfy my itch to play a decent 4x game that has the simplicity and replayability of old Civ and Total War games. 

I would like to congratulate the developers for their splendid job. The game is easy to learn but hard to master with all its challenges. The event progression and historical information provided as you play along are educating and create an immersion with the game world.

But above all I was mesmerized by the graphics and art design. The map and board background, which is very suitable for historical strategy games, is something we cannot enjoy these days as more and more famous franchises move on to hard realistc look. Practical GUI, rather mute colors in the background, simple animations, easy to identify symbols and functions all made this game minimal, elegant and pleasant to play. I only hope we will see more of this game with broader range of historical theme, perhaps a game that spans the entire Ancient world, or Mesopotamia.

Overall a fantastic game and If you are interested in history and enjoy turn based strategy games, Predynastic Egypt is a must buy, especially considering its modest price.

review: A very nice little 4X-like that you may enjoy if you are tired of 20h long Civ games. Less complex than a real 4X, but a lot of interesting challenges. If you like 4X, you definitively should give it a try, especially since it is a low budget game! Enjoy the Egypt!

review:
Un juego de estrategia y simulador del manejo de la civilizacion egipcia de sus inicios.
Me gusto mucho, para ser un juego Indie de bajo presupuesto es muy atractivo y adictivo, si te gustan los juegos de este estilo te recomiendo todos los del estudio ya que varian el sistema pero se basan en lo mismo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092299899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1537575883}
review:
I genuinely don't understand the positive reviews on this.

It's a mobile game and should have stayed there. All the talk of "educational" and "4x strategy" .. I can't see it.

It's simplistic, the graphics are basic, the game seems to involve hitting "next turn" a lot.

I'd refund it if I could.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970556383', 'num_games_owned': 757, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1584405132}
review:
Game just loads to a blue screen with music.  Nothing else.   The escape button closes the program though, so at least I dont have to Ctrl-Alt-Delete.   BUT!    I sent an email to the makers of the game and they responded with some trouble shooting tips.     I opened the game in a beta version (right click in steam, properties, beta, ) specifically  1.0.3 anti-blue ,  and the game runs just fine now.        

I love that the devs are supporing their game and their community like this.    Double Thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198241617958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 7513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2032, 'last_played': 1707774974}
review:
this is one of the best turn-based strategy games i've played in a while. peaceful music , gameplay that is simple and easy to understand, charming graphics, and (mostly) accurate history of pre-dynasty egypt.  
I would easily reccommend this to anyone who likes games of this nature.

P.S , while I was playing the game, I found an event about a craftsman's workshop catching on fire and  8000  years later, it said you would be able to get a one time bonus of 900 culture points, can anyone that has seen this event take a snapshot and show me?

review:
Predinastic Egypt est un jeu aux mÃ©canismes simples qui se rÃ©vÃ¨le plus profond qu'il n'y parait. Equilibrer les ressources et optimiser les bÃ©nÃ©dictions est un vrai casse-tÃªte tant les Ã©vÃ©nements et objectifs se succÃ¨dent sans laisser souffler notre civilisation naissante. Malheureusement cette scÃ©narisation rend les parties trÃ¨s ressemblantes. Sans aller jusqu'Ã  un bac Ã  sable qui serait sans intÃªrÃ©t, plusieurs scÃ©narios auraient Ã©tÃ© les bienvenus. Je vais jeter l'Ã©ponge par lassitude avant d'avoir complÃ¨tement maitrisÃ© ce jeu, dommage.

Avis lÃ©gÃ©rement positif.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010131631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 645, 'last_played': 1528174158}
review:
Solid game well worth the price tag.
Like all other Clarus Victoria games gave me about 10 hours of fun to master it and get all achievements.

It's gameplay style is exactly like playing a board game so people that love those will find like it a lot.

Overall Score - 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198168195953', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 736, 'last_played': 1530409622}
review:
Were it categorized as a educational game, I would recommend it. This game is somewhat linear and lacks of flexibility. The way that this game give feedback to player's decision , id est the trial, is a bit slow and somewhat fails to give enough information for player to adjust strategy, which is important for a strategy game. For a game that try to simulate history, there are two ways to do it. One is try to find the logic behind history like Paradox' games; another is simply tell player that it happens, which this game did.
The reason why so many people recommend it, I guess, might be that there are few game that focused on ancient Aegyptus these years. The only game that comes to my mind (except this game) is ACO. Wish Paradox' new Roma game will have a good DLC focused on Aegyptus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067808906', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 146, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1530121490}
review:
[h1]A short easy-playing non complex little [i]one-more-turn[/i] 4X strategy game, yet enjoyable and relatively informative[/h1]

Recommended if you are looking for a quick relaxing mini sized strategy game. Note that a playthrough is about 220 turns which takes around less than 2 hours and the replayability after that is not very high beside achievement runs. I would give it 10-15 hrs at best regarding cost per hour value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198385666083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 209, 'playtime_forever': 4082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2133, 'last_played': 1691097651}
review:
Autant l'annoncer tout de suite : je n'ai pratiquement jamais jouÃ© Ã  des jeux de gestion de ville / civilisation. Celui-ci est riche, et, me semble-t-il, difficile. Il m'a fallu enchaÃ®ner bon nombre d'essais avant de relever le dÃ©fi final. Ceci dit, le tout dernier objectif n'apparaÃ®t pas clairement et peut faire perdre bÃªtement une partie (la "checklist" est cochÃ©e, mais cela ne suffit pas).

Le travail de recherche historique menÃ© est remarquable, bien que je connaisse davantage la cosmogonie Ã©gyptienne. Les dieux-fondateurs ne sont pas reprÃ©sentÃ©s, et seulement cinq d'entre eux agrÃ©mentent le panthÃ©on, ce qui est un peu dommage (Osiris, Sekhmet, Thot ou Bastet auraient pu Ãªtre exploitÃ©s pour les naissances/dÃ©cÃ¨s et connaissances). PassionnÃ©e par les religions, surtout polythÃ©istes, et nostalgique de la B.D. [i]Papyrus[/i], cet aspect me tient Ã  coeur. Je ne lis pas assez d'Ã©tudes ou de forums consacrÃ©s Ã  l'Ã©gyptologie pour me prononcer sur le reste, qui me semble fourni, mÃªme si j'ai un peu regrettÃ© l'absence de frise chronologique pour accompagner les dÃ©couvertes et inventions techniques. 

Le tout est trÃ¨s plaisant (un subtil Ã©quilibre culture / construction / gestion des armÃ©es), et le challenge est lÃ  : les missions Ã  remplir sont trÃ¨s nombreuses en quelques 220 tours. Un manque d'entraÃ®nement, et l'Ã©chec est vite arrivÃ© !

MalgrÃ© ces deux-trois rÃ©serves, je salue le beau travail des Ã©quipes de Clarus Victoria. La suite, [i]Egypt : Old Kingdom[/i], me tente bien.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066068285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1689281141}
review:
I'm recommending it because it seems intelligently made and essentially delivered what was promised but I didn't get a lot of enjoyment out of it. I think marble age is a lot better, it's completely stupid but it was simple and fun to play. This game runs on most of the same mechanics but adds complicated and annoying features that seem unfair and are hard to wrap your head around, and lacks the satisfying feeling of marble age due to its attempt to be 'authentic' or whatever. 

Like I said, it's fine but for $10 dollars I would think hard if this is a game you want.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971128285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1528722728}
review:
Das Problem, dass ich mit dem Spiel habe, ist nicht der SpielspaÃŸ, sondern der Umfang. 
Wenn man sich vor dem Kauf die Demoversion ansieht, hat man bereits 50% des Spiels gesehen.
Und das kann nicht sein. Wenn man es (von der Spieldauer her) gar mit Pharaoh + Cleopatra vergleichen mÃ¶chte, kommt man gefÃ¼hlt auf ca. 1% der Spieldauer des Klassikers. An sich ein nettes Spielchen, aber wegen des des schwachen Umfangs, nicht den vollen Preis Wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096833876', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 147, 'playtime_forever': 231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1528555596}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052582282', 'num_games_owned': 1659, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1522565023}
review:
Clarus Victoria, have put together a most excellent game!  As many of my friends and review-followers know, I am an avid-gamer, and as some of you know, I am an Egyptologist as well (having studied at Harvard, Yale, and University of Pennslyvania, etc).  This usually means a lot of Egypt-based games or mods in my play-time... and a lot of dissapointment in the extreme separation from historical reality.

I am most pleased to say... this game is amazing.  One of the best historically accurate games covering Egypt I have ever played.  If you love Egypt, you are going to LOVE this game, that keeps a pretty steady course on Ancient Egypt as we really know it.  It leaves you begging for the next chapter.

Game Mechanic wise - its a pretty straight forward resource building, stat balancing, event-rich map-level strategy game.

((MORE REVIEWS)) TO SEE OTHER INSIGHTFUL REVIEWS, HEAD TO https://steamcommunity.com/groups/lordvongames ((THUMBS UP, JOIN the Group, Discuss Reviews))

Comparison wise - Its what Europa Universalis "should" be, if it were to step back into the Ancient times, lose its overwhelmingly generic interface, and take on the immersive style and art characteristics (and UI) of the country it is playing (in this case Ancient Egypt), and add in culturally realistic - nation building - important events, to shape and develop.

Great game!  Buy it on sale.  Buy it at full price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198837349102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1690098584}
review:
First game I bought on steam. 
It's a simple card game if I would describe it. 

It's more to resource management. When it comes to battle, you cannot control it. 
Learnt about Ancient Egyptian history.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059334622', 'num_games_owned': 600, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1528169089}
review:
Well I been playing Claus Victoria games as the free flash games and decided to try out their new game. Well not their newest anymore!

I like it. It's different that the previous ones in terms of aesthetic, but still has the same magical touch from the same devs. It's fun. And you get to learn stuff too! Never cared at all for history and always found it to be extremely boring in school. This game makes it more fun. I also happened to play this while I was having a casual David Icke binge marathon so I think I can safely say I know a thing or two about history now hahahahha.

Anyways get it if you like this dev! It's got some diff difficulty (ala their lastest flash game) settings to spice things up. I just beat it with the easy settings. But the medium and hard difficulties are pretty tough. It requires an exntirely diff starting strategy which is the most important part of these kind of games. So yeah, if you like trial and error and getting ur ass kicked lol, pick it up.

ignore the part where it says how many hours cause i play offline and i played at least like 10-15+hrs

author: {'steamid': '76561198008505933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1699322535}
review: Amazing little game! I absolutely loved it, and completed it twice in the first two days. Put 11 hours in to the game during the two playthroughs, so it is quite a quick game to finish, but I really enjoyed it! If you want to know more about the game, it recommend watching a little bit of a let's play on youtube or something, but don't watch a complete playthrough as that will ruin some of the fun in learning the game :) It isn't that hard to figure out trust me, but mastering it is a different story. Got the bronze award the first time and the silver second time around. Maybe I'll pick it up again to get the gold on day ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198079530646', 'num_games_owned': 457, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1527632949}
review: A lightweight 4x game on rails without strategy and flexibilty designed for tablets. Follow the script or fail the objectives. There is only one way to victory and if you stray away from this path by the slightest deviation then you are unable to achieve all victory goals. I was excited at first until you notice you are just playing a script. The late game in particular gets silly where it throws so many bonuses your way, out of nowhere, that I had the feeling I wasn't being taken serious as a gamer by the devs. Way too overrated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263427469', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1529283684}
review:
An awesome economic strategy game.

I played this game long time ago using a pirate copy. I have just bought to respect developers.
P.s. i don't play cracked games :D

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1395580472

You are a ruler of one small Egyptian tribe. You need to raise your power to conquer all Egypt. The game follows the real story, so it's nice to play/learn. The game is turn based economic strategy game. It doesn't require fast reaction, but wise choices.

There are a lot of small mechanics in the game. The game offers even more during the game. You start with exploration of the location. After you need to gather resources, construct buildings, research techs, raiding or trading other tribes and etc. Very interesting.

There are several trials in the game. They are very hard, but enjoyable to complete.

I can say a lot about this game, but I will say what I spent more than 20 hours in it trying to win it on the highest difficulty.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1395580441

Pros
- A kinda innovative gameplay. It's a mix from different mechanics. Requires wise control of tour kingdom to achieve victory.
- Interesting building/exploration/battle and tech mechanics.
- Nice historical addition to the game. Learn more about Old Egypt playing the game.
- Different difficulty settings fit for all kind of players.
- The game interesting in the start and in the end of the game.
- Offers new mechanics during all game

Cons
- Playing the hardest difficulty requires a lot of save/load
- Some negative random effects can hurt too much

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1395580517

[h1]Resume[/h1]
Very interesting game with challenging and engaging gameplay. I recommend this game to all strategy fans for a full price

author: {'steamid': '76561197972834969', 'num_games_owned': 1418, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1527361586}
review:
It's like Civilization-Lite, it's great!

I was surprised by how good, how mechanically tight, this game is.  It plays a bit like a strategy board game where you play through the ages of egypt, from first settling the immediate nile, to then conquering/uniting all of egypt.  It's a worker placement game and it always matters where you place your workers to work what tiles.  The progression is really good, with technologies to research and buildings that change the landscape in interesting ways.

I played the whole game through in one 3.5hr sitting.  Exactly what I wanted for being stuck in a hotel for half a day.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972564965', 'num_games_owned': 755, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1527304548}
review:
There is both more and less to this game than I first assumed, but in many ways, what I missed from my expectations ended up revealing the purpose of the game. Let me explain:

In the game, you guide ancient Egyptians from 4000BC as they settle down along the nile and create the proto-kingdom that is Predynastic Egypt. You do this through a series of finite turns (although you can keep playing after the win/loss conditin, more on that later). Each turn, you may have a few options avilable to you; building things, harvesting things, fighting or politiking other tribes, shuffeling people around, etc. Each turn, certain events may trigger like floods or good harvest, you get the picture, it's roadblocks and opportunities. Depending on the current situtation, you will likely be shuffeling around your workers to maximiaze resource production for whatever current goal your pusruing.  The game does a decent job of introducing steps gradually, but I did manage to fail my first playthrough by running out of time and thus learned more about how to win at the game at the end rather than the beginning. Which brings me to my next point, replayability.

I didn't manage to win the beginner game until my third attempt, and I did two of those back to back. This game offers a challenege that is deceptive given its simple, yet attractive presentation. Although my first failure was the result of my ignorance of properly understanding how to succeed, my second failure was plain as day and inspired me to give it another go immediatly after failing. I was so close! And 3rd time's a charm anyway. But after having beat it, there isn't much reason to go back. There are no custom scenarios or different maps, you can alter the ruleset a bit, make it more challenging to go for those sweet sweet achievements, but you're playing the same narrative arc, on the same map , just with more roadblocks and less opportunities. At the end of the game, regardless of whether you win or lose, you can also continue playing, just in case you want to see things to completion without actually winning. One minor complaint is that I wish the game would remidn you more often how many turns are left until waiting until it's almost too late to do anything about it if you're behind. 

That being said, its brevity and focused design make it and excellent educational game. This is what I meant by missed expectations revealing the game's purpose. I was expecting a game that would let me do what this game was doing, but in ways that may not be aligned with history. This game is not like the old Siera games like Pharoh and Cleopetra. Building and research is fairly linear, and you only have one settlement you directly control, this is a guided tour through history presented as a compelling game. And you know what? It worked. I learned something, and I am looking forward to the sequel of this game, to pick up where this story ended.

TL;DR This is a bite-size management game that is compelling for a few playthroughs but offers an educational tour through a time and place I know little about. I enjoyed it and would recommend it to any fans of turn-based management games and those looking for a slow paced and attractive game to whittle away some time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007471169', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1036, 'last_played': 1527902363}
review:
"Hello, Chieftain here. It has come to my attention that the priesthood has been holding back some very important information that could be of use to the tribe. Please forward that information to my house immediately."

"Dearest glorious Chieftain, we were assigned a mission to research the mysteries of the world. There was no specification that we share this with anyone outside of the priesthood."

So yes, getting info out of the priests is like pulling teeth in my first game. Of course, I was so focused on trying to expand lands and preserve the tribe in the face of bloodthirsty cannibals (I'm quite sure they were cannibals), that the priests just kept hoarding info until I had 45 research points piled up. I finally applied these points, but in the first three challenges, I keep coming up just short of completing them, unfortunately, the delay has put our development just behind the power curve.

Stupid priests, now we have to go to a different tribe's city to worship at the main Horus temple!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025067795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1527494286}
review:
The developer's previous two games were alright, but this game takes the cake! Grow from humble town to glorious nation is this pre-dynastic Egyptian kingdom simulator.
This game was clearly crafted with a lot of love and care. The attention to detail and effort put into the smallest things make this game a blast to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063344121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 707, 'last_played': 1527039092}
review:
If there was something between a thumbs up and a thumbs down, I'd give it that. So I'm giving this game a tentative recommendation. The graphics are very nice, the UI is clean and intuitive, and the turn-based game mechanic is easy to learn with a fun, challenging narrative walking you through the founding of ancient Egypt. I just wish there was more to it. More scenarios after you finish the (very rushed) historical campaign would have been nice. Like the option to play a campaign based entirely on farming, or military, or exploration, etc etc. Or just being able to TURN OFF the campaign mode so you can play at your own pace. But besides being able to change the level of difficulty, the game is pretty much exactly the same every play through. And it only takes a couple of hours or less to get through it.

Which is a shame because I really love what's there! I liked it so much I played it through 3 times. It's just really well done with the bits of history interspersed with city building and the various challenges of managing your resources. If it included more varied content to stretch out the experience it would be perfect. So get it while it's on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198152014437', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1526536430}
review:
[h1] An accessible, beautiful and unique take on the city building genre with a mix of time attack. [/h1]

+ Good visulas
+ Good Gameplay 
+ Satisfying Economic Development
+ Easy to get into and very challenging to master

Predynastic Egypt is a turn-based economic game focused on the prehistoric period of Egypt (5000-3500 BC) in which you gather resources, build your city, engage in diplomacy and strive against historical challenges to survive and build a great civilization. It is an accessible game with which a wider audience can have fun and enjoy the beautfiul visulas on the easy difficulty. Then for those interested in a hard challenge, the normal and hard difficulties offer a challenge that will take quite some time to master as well as a score and achievements. 

What is different in this game from other similar games is that you only get one map-your own city and later one area map of Egypt to expand on. You do not build many cities, but instead try to take one city through a series of historical events starting from pre-agricultural settling to the founding of the Egyptian dynasties while managing your workers and adapting to wars, diplomatic events, migrations, draughts, invasions and more. It is very important to know that there is no scenario generator so know this before buying and don't be disappointed. For what it is though, the game does an excellent job. It has you going through the same historical challenge as you would let's say in Stronghold but each time there are different random events and placements which happen such as the fact that once you will start surrounded by peaceful tribes that you can trade with and assimilate and the next time you can be surrounded by warmongering enemies that attack you frequently. Similarly, you can start with many resources around you and events to find people to assimilate to your workforce or bad events that hinder your growth. Thus, the game is a mix between a historical pre-set path and random events and always keeps being interesting. 

I really liked the visuals of this game and also the neat economic system, You really feel the growth from a small tribe to an economic power. Also, it is clear that much work was put into it as it tries to  share much interesting information with the player in an entertaining way. For example, from the start and up until the end of the game, every technology has a uniquely designed painting of Egyptian hieroglyphs and satisfying descriptions of what it does upon research completion. For the price that I paid for this game, it is very polished.  

The only valid criticism that I have seen people make to this game is that you do not get to choose your own path in a very wide way. There is much choice of where to explore, what and when to build and how to allocate resources but some paths will be better than the others and if you want to keep playing the game for more score and extra achievements you must remember them. Be prepared for this and if this sounds fun, the game is good. I really enjoyed it. This game is not Civilization nor any kind of 4X, it's new, different and good for what it is.

I really enjoyed the detailed setting. I learnt much about ancient Egypt. I liked the economic gameplay, the graphics and the growth coupled with the fact that every playthrough gets better and I learnt for example from one playthrough to the next how to almost triple my economy and explore much faster. 

The game is part of a historical economic and time attack series made by Clarus Victoria. If you enjoy it, their new game, Egypt Old Kingdom is scheduled to launch on the 24th of May 2017 and they also had previous games which featured prehistory and ancient times (Bronze Age) and Greek ancient and medieval history (Marble Age). Although, having played the whole series, I think this game is the easiest to get into and then if you want more complex trade you can check out Marble Age, though it is quite a bit different.

Happy Gaming! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198052805169', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1523786514}
review:
Consiglio questo gioco a tutti gli appassionati dell'Egitto perchÃ© Ã¨ curato sotto ogni aspetto. Non Ã¨ paragonabile a qualsiasi altro gioco di "strategia" nel senso stretto del termine alla "civilization" o alla "age of empires" dove selezionate le unitÃ  e le muovete, piuttosto dovete distribuire delle "carte animate" che di fatto rappresentano gli egiziani assegnando compiti per produrre risorse, produrre progresso, autoritÃ , edifici e anche l'esercito. 
La cosa che colpisce piÃ¹ in questo gioco, secondo me, Ã¨ l'accuratezza del livello artistico, i disegni sono spettacolari, cosÃ¬"egiziani"!  Chiunque sia affascinato dall'Egitto antico non puÃ² che rimanere colpito. Il sonoro fa tornare in dietro nel tempo e nonostante non sia un "tradizionale" gioco di strategia, si rimane catturati e coinvolti dalla semplicitÃ  che allo stesso tempo ci regala un po di storia. 
Non a tutti perÃ² puÃ² piacere, Ã¨ un gioco di nicchia, uno strategico diverso dai soliti.
Il mio personale voto Ã¨ : 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198008356144', 'num_games_owned': 573, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 2003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1616, 'last_played': 1553300472}
review: This is a charming "little" game about the formation of the Egyptian Kingdom. I know that the duration is short and the replaybility value is very limited but the game is quite interesting (if you understand that this is no Civilization) and fun especially if you buy it during a sale for less than 5 Euros. It even has some historical information for those who're interested.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009316578', 'num_games_owned': 606, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1522178128}
review:
This game is appallingly short, more so given that it's essentially a boardgame. I finished the entire campaign in a bit over 2 hours. There are movies on Netflix with more entertainment value than that, and this costs more than a month of sub.

I should say in the interest of fairness that the history is kinda cool if you're a buff, graphics have a certain flare, and the gameplay isn't bad as boardgames go, so it's not all bad. 

Still, games that take less time to finish than it takes to find a new game to play when you're done with them should come with a disclaimer - in the meantime, don't reward devs for this sort of thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055863344', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1522072670}
review: It's very history based. Amazingly done and FUN. One of the most important periods in the world that hatched a legendary state and culture (for better and worse)

author: {'steamid': '76561198329283449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 895, 'last_played': 1536858587}
review:
This lived on my wishlist for a while before I finally ended up buying it, and I wish I'd bought this earlier! Incredibly addicting yet not overly complicated-- but still with enough of a strategy approach to keep you [strike] retrying twenty times because you keep losing[/strike] invested. Think of it as a slightly less high maintenance Civ on (for better or worse) a shorter timeline.

I also really loved the little history factoids that popped up whenever you did something/moved on through time! It was a nice touch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137012307', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1527516041}
review:
Great game. Very accurate in history. Polished arts and clean UI. Good background music. Great to understand more about Egypt timeline. However, the game is a bit short and lack of replayability (however I didn't expect such things in an educational game). I might play it one or two more times in the future. Worth every single cent!

Looking forward to its next sequel: Old Kingdom.

Note: I have no idea whether this game's Steam Cloud functionality is working or not. My storage indicates "0 bytes" usage. So you should backup your save file, just in case.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974316066', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1520780629}
review:
I can't remember if I got it through a bundle or if it suddenly popped up in my steam library. I honestly don't remember if I actually bought it. However after one playthrough I'm left with a feeling of... meh. 

By all means, it's not a bad game. It's actually quite good to be honest. The mechanics are similar to Sid Meier's Civ games; you have allocated spots on your map that produce various resources; mainly food and production in the beginning. At first you're hunter gatherer so there's not much to begin with. You build workers to gain the resources on the different plot. Then you start improving these fields and get more food and production and also what I guess you can call "research" points to upgrade in general or get new buildings and finally the "rarest" is a variation of culture that you spend on one of the gods to get a time limited bonus. You build and expand your city and eventually you'll build military buildings to increase your military points. You don''t' have specific military units, but an overall military strength. Once you're strong enough you can raid an enemy to lower their strength(then you'll face about 50% of the enemy strength) and or straight up subjugate them(face the full force). Battle is pretty much RNGeesus with bonus either way of ambushes, flanking or killing commanders. There's no tactics involved, just be stronger. 

It's an alright game that I spent two hours to go through. It wasn't a waste of time, but it doesn't feel like it has some kindd of replayability. If you can get it for the price you'll spend on 2-4 hours on a play through then it's not the worst purchase you'll ever make of a game(looking at you Agents of Mayhem!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198018644139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1519789724}
review: This game is excellent. Interesting, fresh, fun, easy to get into and play. I don't think it will eat as many hours as something like Civ since it is more linear, but it is also much cheaper and, as I said, really fresh. author: {'steamid': '76561197995689937', 'num_games_owned': 530, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 456, 'last_played': 1708285549}
review: I've struggled with how to describe this game - "historical simulation" maybe? From the screenshots, and when you start playing it, it seems like a very well-polished Civilization mod. However it becomes apparent that it's more focussed than a game of Civ, to the point of being on rails. You get to make the low-levels decisions - where to put your workers, which buildings to build, who to trade with - but the game gives you the same high-level goals every time - explore this area, make contact with Palestine, conquer this tribe. So it's doesn't offer a huge amount of replayability to your typical gamer (I've played it once, and can see me playing it maybe twice more) but it gives you a much richer and more accurate experience than a regular strategy game. I'd read about early Egyptian history a few times but playing through it like this has given me a far better understanding of what actually happened, where, when, and why. Very cool! I'll definitely be picking up Old Kingdom when it comes out.

review:
What can I say about this game?
Everything about it is great.

Whether you are preparing for war,
Uniting the tribes in your region by battling with
Zulu-like ferocity, this is the game for you.

Kingship with the ancient Egyptians is 
Among the most facinating topics of study, and
Nowhere do I see a better primer than in this
Game and how it 
Symplisticaly puts such a complex issue.

review: I'll just preface with the whole "I actually have a degree in archaeology" thing and say that this is - hands down - one of my favorite things on Steam right now. It's fun, it's engaging, it's challenging, and it's accurate! It feels like a civ game, but with it's own flavor. The different difficulty levels give it a certain amount of re-playability also. Highly Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997228817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1516111243}
review:
A very good educational game. Replayability is probably limited to about 3 play throughs, but that's not what you purchase this game for. For me, it felt like an interactive learning environment where you can absorb a lot of information about predynastic Egypt, and how it became unified.

The learning level I would probably rate at around 12 years old.

The game itself has plenty of choices that need to be made, and you do need to make strategic decisions.

I recommend the game at full price, because it's not that expensive and it will support the developers to make more wonderful little games like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992336139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1545140298}
review:
I really enjoyed the game, as a gamer for the dynamics and the challange in achieving the different goals; as an historical expert I've also appreciated the historical accuracy and the research that there is behind the game. The game offers several hours of play and fun, as well as strategy and the possibility to re-play the game to make better choices.
Strongly advised for anyone who is fun of the historical and strategy games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025479920', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1511392923}
review: This is a pretty nice game, good empire-building strategy. The main deficiency is that there is only one scenario. author: {'steamid': '76561198135666277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1857, 'last_played': 1546755626}
review: This game defies description. It's an empire builder, but it's not. There are battles, but there aren't. You have to play it to understand the game. You play as an ancient Egyptian who is pulling the Egyptian people out of the mists of time to build a true dynasty. But watch watch out, you only have a limited time.

review: es un juego supe-adictivo entra en frio y pronto entras en calor desarrollando tu ciudad y el resto de egipto pero con el inconveniente muy importante de que la carrera para ganar es epica y muy dificil de conseguir, entre eso las tumbas reales y la guerra para dominar el sinai hasta que no controlas a uaput el abridor de caminos y para colmo la capital es dificil de construir en las fases finales y no digamos el nivel de clasificaciÃ³n te puedes matar tratando de hacerlo bien y que te digan al final que eres tan sabio como un bebe tembloroso y lloron y par colmo las pruebas son demasiado duras desde el inalcanzable exodo del sahara hasta la guerra santa entre horus y seth la prueba del novio tan corta o la del panteon unico imposible de conseguir por mucho que reces a los dioses y luego le das mil y una vueltas para saber si lo podrias haber hecho mejor, lo recomiendo pero cuando lo arreglen de verdad
