author: {'steamid': '76561198011316205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1660655327}
review:
Der neue Teil der Pre-Civ Reihe verfeinert das Gameplay deutlich und bietet ein dynamischere Zuganzahl als die alten Teile indem das Spielende nicht an einem Zeitpunkt eingestellt ist.
Es fÃ¼hlt sich mehr wie die bekannte Civilization-Reihe an, bietet jedoch im Vergleich zu diesem nur einen geringen Wiederspielwert da die Karte immer die gleiche bleibt.

Das Punktesystem aus den alten Teilen wurde Ã¼bernommen und bietet eine spannende Challenge, es gibt ausserdem Karten, mit welchen man seine Nation zu Beginn des Spieler customizen kann.

FÃ¼r den Preis von 9.00 eine definitive Kaufempfehlung

author: {'steamid': '76561198014197409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1808, 'last_played': 1674358010}
review:
If you are thing this is another Civ open world clone you will be horribly mistaken. So I would recomend playing the demo first before to get idea what it about and how it plays.
This game is a historical reenactment it interactive history. There is very little handholding and you got figure it out on your own. So the question where is the fun in that if you know how it end. Well as the player we can fail and fail a lot you will!! The graphic suit the game well. What real fun of game trying is managment your people well enought that you can keep up with world throw at you see them grown from small grow of hunter and gathers to the first nation State in the west! Give you idea how awesome it was egypt came into being at all. I would dare say as well it one better educational game as it will teach you history. So if your history lover and like trial give this one a shot!

One thing I love about this game is it scope! This game being at year 5000 BC in Prehistoric Egypt. You start as a small tribe of hunter and gather in mild of mirgration. Now each turn is span of 20 years. You as you play see then settle into area deveplment way suriving and meeting culture more advance then them. One great thing about this game with name drop culture wha limit intereactive your tribe had with so in turn you can look it up if curious. If want to get the most point by the end of the game you have to advance your tribe as was it historic missions and do well trials that get throw at you. You see them deveplement into the badari culture. Which is intresting because you tell you something special about this prehistoric nile culture but if you are like you them up later. Once you reach that point in the game your people are settle farmer the women are reverned you tribe of hunter and grather inevolved into fully settle people and looking as falcon as good luck as turn into own reglion. By end of end of the game your playing as almost mythical ancient King Narmer bring the under and lower Kingdom together building Memphis the last of prehistoric/predynastic kings and the first dynastic king. You give idea of this game scope.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996375739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1477007595}
review: The game is somehow very inspired by King of Dragon Pass mechanics, in a lighter and simplified way; it doesn't therefore have the depth of KoDP, but it's still enjoyable for a few hours. I'll keep on playing and I'll update my review if necessary.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990260118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1476458494}
review:
It is a great game if you want to spend time and learn more about the history and culture of egypt. But it is not an RTS or Turn-based conquest game, and if that is what you want, don't buy it.  
It is a really iculturally in-depth  time-waster, and I mean that in the best possible sense. You could spend hours in this game,
Me? It's not to my personal taste, but I do heartily recomend that you give it a go and possibly learn something, it's pocket-money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038169657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1477145617}
review:
its just stupid hard, i had 3k troops vs 1k, and i lost horribly cause i got 4 bad "battle events" in a row. Potential is here but the game is just retardedly hard cause random shit.

This is an updated version of my review. The new patch has made up for a lot of the problems i had with the game. I had two playthroughs and not once did i get more then two negative events in a row. The game is much more enjoyable now. 

I have a complaint that i would like an easier way to be able to spot how i can earn bronze/silver/gold ratings on the missions. When you get a mission i would love it you could see what was needed to get those ratings. 

Overall its a cool game.
developer_response:
Hi! Thanks to your negative review â€“ we fixed everything with new 1.0.1. update and we would like to ask you to play it and tell us your opinion.

Thanks for helping us to make the better game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002726626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1477958057}
review: I am very pleased with the game however I feel a bit rushed. I knew this game wouldn't have tons of content and is fairly linear but I feel the turn limit reduces the time played artificially. Would be nice to have an option to just play the game without a turn limit and finish it in your own pace.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029751571', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1476406259}
review: Lacks replay value, but not a bad game all things considered. It could have been a real contender if it had randomly generated maps, quests and tribes. Worth a play-through, but isn't very interesting on run number two.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000671988', 'num_games_owned': 1115, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1520764073}
review:
I was really surprised how much I was loving this little game, one clearly designed for iPads and ported to computers â€¦ until my machine kernel-panic'd right as I was reaching completion, and I lost six hours' playing.

If your game is railroaded, and only really has one storyline / set of content, it's unacceptable to make the player start over once they've experienced most of it already.

0/10, fucking implement autosave
developer_response:
Hi Elliott! We would like to apologize for the fact that we had not been implemented AutoSave in the moment when you played, but now with the 1.0.1 update it is done, and such situation will not happen again.

You must have mixed Pre-Civilization Egypt with Pre-Civilization Marble Age â€“ the Egypt was created for PC and now is being ported to the mobile platforms.

I hope will be able to return to the game and will appreciate our efforts to make it better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005929523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1558601712}
review:
An amazing game.
+  Strong visuals thanks to its design. This game is beautiful in its own way. You are totally drawn into the Egyptian setting.
+ Historically correct without being a history simulator.
+ Addictive gameplay, you really want to grow your tribe into a civilization.
+ Challenging! You'll restart more than once! Everytime you'll get further, without being too disheartened.
+ One more turn...

- A bit short, replay value could be higher

author: {'steamid': '76561198139023985', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1497007931}
review:
The game style and mechanics are really good but it is so linear that you have exactly the same experience every time, just with a different strategic approach. You feel like you are being driven down a path without the startegic options to make up your own mind.
Lots of peotential especially with an open strategy model, but this one-way linnear experience doesn't cut it....
developer_response:
Hi, thanks for the feedback, but it is strange thatâ€™s you review is negative after such a good word about the game. The game seems linear because it is based on the real history of Egypt. But now, almost any strategy game is linear: Xâ€“Com series gives only tactical freedom, in the rest, except for the side missions, it is linear. Tropico series â€“ the same linear missions. Almost any strategic series are linear today.

We made a historical game and it has rails - the history of Pre-Dynastic Egypt. The trials are real historical milestones, but players are free to choose different tactics for strategic development to achieve different goals. So, we don't differ from other strategy games in our approach.

Please try the new game balance in 1.0.1 update and we will be happy if you will change your mind.

review:
It can be fun but even on easy difficulty the fighting part of game is very hard and diplomacy only works on a few of .s  Simlar to their previous game Pre-Civilization Marble Age.  In the game, it's not possible to build enough armies to complete mission and finish the game before game time runs outThe gaI buld up to Ridiculously sized  armies amd have fighting is the only way to get some of the 13 statesrmy size which is difficult to do before end of game time. I know cheap game, but too shortalsoo think the timeline  could be expanded at very llittle resource cost to the deveeloper (edit dates, etc.).

Hi Dan! We have listened to your words and released the 1.0.1 patch. Which makes the game much easier and changes the game balance in favor of the player. Thank you for helping us to make the better game.

And yes, you can now continue playing after the completion of the historical campaign.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007341245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 632, 'last_played': 1490706658}
review:
The game requires a decent level of strategy, and is quite fun, but in its current state does not have much replay-ability, at least for me. For the price I paid (US$8), I am quite happy with my purchase, but am disappointed that I won't be playing much more of it. 

EDIT: Having replayed this game since a MAJOR UPDATE, many of the issues I had detailed below have been fixed. 


My experiences and criticisms are set out below:

I found myself identifying with many of the challenges faced by another reviewer (Saint Ceo de la Vegas), where in both my playthorughs, I started the game on easy, and in that setting I found the challenges within the "settlement screen" difficult, but achievable. I managed to unite my region, amass (what I thought was) a substantial army, was constructing buildings quickly and in line with technological advances. 

However, as soon the game shifted to an Egypt-wide emphasis ("fog of war map"), any progress I had made seemed woefully limited. The challenges to build, explore, unite and fight cities were just too substantial. 

I completely shifted all production to military in order to attempt to build an army that could come close to taking on Seth (or at least defend myself against Seth, which I was able to do), but still couldn't come close to having enough soldiers for this. I was able to unite 4 or 5 tribes at this level, build a 3k + strong army, but I never felt in a position to even confront the smallest Seth settlement. 

I was totally unable to build several of the special tombs due to lack of exploration at this point (despite having more than enough workers and resources) ... it just came down to timing and exploration, I wasn't fast enough and the game punished me for it, this can be good and bad. 

In this case however, I felt that even if I had sped up my style of play and succeeded in building the tombs, I wouldn't have been able to challenge Seth militarily anyway, and this was confirmed in my second playthough.

I want to qualify this review by saying I enjoyed the game and would recommend it. 

In reaction to the developer: I do not think a special mode needs to be created to make the game "much easier". I'd suggest within the current easy mode, just reduce scouting times, and reduce the size of a few of the enemy armies (or make building armies faster/easier... for instance instead of +6 soldiers on a site, make it +12, or whatever).

author: {'steamid': '76561198011300382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1476297442}
review: It's fun for an hour or so, but by the time you realize it isn't worth $9 you have probably already played it too long to return it.
developer_response:
Hey, you gave us a negative review only because of the price? We are a little flattered that you put our game in one line with the Europe Universalis IV, which you played 419 hours and also gave the game a thumbs down :-). If it's only because of the price, then I would like to cite the same words that I wrote to another player, who whined about the price:

If our game would only entertain the player, I would agree with you.
But playing our game you are getting the knowledge about history and culture of Pre-dynastic Egypt

- The city that you build, is real one and now being excavated http://www.hierakonpolis-online.org .

- The building that you are constructing was reconstructed by the best archeologists and Egyptologists.

- Events in which you are participate, are bit by bit restored episodes of the history of the foundation of the Egyptian state.

- The discoveries that you making in the game is a real technological evolution of Egyptian civilization: many inventions were made on the banks of the Nile, about which we are telling in details in the descriptions and the game events.

Do you think that it's not worth movie ticket or burger+cola?

author: {'steamid': '76561198001418172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1476253034}
review: It's visual novel-tier linear, but still interesting. First playthrough took about 3.5h while taking good time and learning. Challenging even on "easy". Would recommend if you're interested in strategy and the egypt-setting.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975745917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1476240099}
review:
The big potential pitfall is if you go into this looking for a "heavier" game. The decisions available at any give time are fairly limited, the basic starting situation is roughly the same with every playthrough, and a big part of the game is about having gathered the proper resources for events that occur at set times. These things make this more of a strategy-puzzle game, and if that's not something you enjoy you're going to be in for a nasty surprise when you start up your second playthrough.

Other than that caveat, the only real complaint I have is the inability to turn off the tutorials, but those are unobtrusive enough. Overall, this is a really solid game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032776165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1476302693}
review:
One of the best games I've played recently, it has a very good money-to-value ratio. 

It reminds me of Pharaoh and Cleopatra, but on an entirely different scale - you start as a small tribe of several hunter-gatherers and gradually you shift to a more advanced society, creating first religions, alphabets, assimilating or killing other tribes - this is a wonderful experience for anyone who likes pre-civiliazation era. 

Once your settlement is large enough, you will proceed to create a proto-state and then a true state. This requires a lot of skill and cunning, and diplomacy and very careful resource allocation is a must. 

One word of advice - expand north, FAST, or else you're screwed. Ignore your enemies and they will grow in numbers in no time.


Some cons now:
1. The replayability value is lower because there is no randomly generated map - you will start in the same place, with the same resources and the same tribes. Not exactly the best feature.
2. Personally, I'd like to see some more diplomatic options - marriages, alliances, little more detail about how faith is spread etc.


Despite the cons, I can heartily recommend it. It is a very good game, and has a good price too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060949602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1502228217}
review:
Nice game which i personally couldn't compare to any other really. It's a civ builder that controls your development. And this is not at all a bad thing. Actually it  makes a refreshing change. 

I did find a small problem whuch the devs responded to almost instantly. Showing excellent customer relations & working very hard to fix it. This is also a very refreshing change :)) And if their devotion is a guide, then this game will leave a lasting & pleasant experience :)
I wish them good fortune & send my thanks.

Certainly has tons of potential and i look forward to future expansions / editions.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060103413', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1487478395}
review:
My first 30 minutes or so I enjoyed the game - I thought it was relaxing and fun.  That changed.

My scores on my games were:  0/35, -1/35, -1/35, 0/35, -0/35  - I only completed all the way to the end twice. THAT's on EASY? setting. You gotta be f ing kidding me?  So I played 6 hours. I tried the easiest setting supposedly. The fastest game was FIVE turns where mysteriously my two guys just disappeared?! The first guy or the second guy ALWAYS seems to disappear on turn 4 for some reason? EVERY time.  Your guy disappears on turn 4.  (WTF?)

The game crushes you on 'easy' setting, I have no idea what it does on harder settings ( that makes it not fun for me, makes me give the game a bad review, tell my friends not to buy it, and post negative in the forums).  

I found it to be unrealistic to 'win' the different levels / challenges. I tried expanding fast, didn't work. I tried expanding slow to build up resources, didn't work as the game just cascades down on you that you are behind to build a temple or whatever because you have been trying to gather resources â€“ or else the game just attacks you with superior numbers.

I have like 400 guys and get crushed by an army of over 1000 because I haven't even discovered the other tribes I need.  When I do find the tribes to bolster my army, I don't have enough little hammer production to give them gifts and 'Unite' in time.   One time I actually DID have more soldiers than the attacking army (barely), but they won because they 'flanked' me?  Where do I learn flanking, or anti-flanking, or anything I need?  Nowhere, game over, city defeated.

The game tells you that I have so many turns to build something and I haven't even explored the North of the city I need to progress the discoveries I need.  There's an automatic blockade, and so I have to stop everything to research and research to get the workaround. 

BOTH times I got to the '15 turns to end of game' warning I was NOWHERE near uncovering the fog of war map, let alone converting the tribes I need!  So in 15 turns I have to uncover the rest of the map, and fight or convert like 7 cities?  Really?  I think the BEST I got was ONE city on the big map converted before getting the 15 turn warning.

The biggest army I amassed by end game was 1.1K, meanwhile Seth had one city with 7K, a couple with 3K, and more... really?  This is EASY?  This is FUN?

Honestly, did you have ANYone test this thing out that is a casual gamer that doesn't know the code?  ... or was I it?  Did I have to buy the f ing game to test it for you and give you game play feedback?  Hey, it's not expensive, so thumbs up there, BUT if all it does is end up pizzing me off, then it doesn't matter, does it?
developer_response:
Hi! First of all - all of your your comments were fixed in 1.0.1 update. You probably have the most popular negative review ;). We are sorry that you had to go through this sad experience, but it is your opinion and few similar opinions have helped us to release the update 1.0.1 and eliminate the possibility of negative experience you experienced. I hope that with a new update we have returned to you the good feeling of the first 30 minutes, you have written above.

In the new update the easy difficulty become as easer as possible and on the 134 turn the new player now can enable the training mode, which will allow calmly play to the end of the game without any tension. And after the completion of the historical campaign the players can continue the game. I hope that you will be able to evaluate it personally.

review: SchÃ¶nes Spiel. Macht sehr viel Freude. Das Spiel unterscheidet sich von seinem "VorgÃ¤nger" Pre-Civ Marble Age, hat mehr Tiefe und Wiederspiel-Wert. Technisch habe ich keinerlei MÃ¤ngel feststellen kÃ¶nnen. Einziger Wermutstropfen ist im Moment, dass das Spiel nur auf Englisch und Russisch zu haben ist. Aber ich denke, dass auch Deutsch bald, wie auch bei Pre-Civ Marble Age, angeboten werden wird. Die 9 â‚¬ ist das Spiel auf jeden Fall wert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045848595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1494164551}
review:
I can easily recommend this game after playing for about two hours. If you played Marble Age(the same studio), you will feel home after few minutes. Egypt just multiplies the content, possibilities and activities but still keeps the same formula and fun (if you like this game style). 

The price may be a bit higher, would prefer 5 dollar range but not sad paying a bit more. 

If you are unsure about this game being your cup of tea, just go and try Marble Age (it's often on sale). Having fun with that game? You definitely should buy this one.  

In case I find some problems, playing this game, I will update this opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984668685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1476247515}
review: It's like civilization, but with a narrowed scope to be just Egypt for a fixed period with fixed enemies.  Overall, I do like it, but there are certain quality of life improvements they could have made like highlighting regions and such that could have made the game easier to understand.  After a while too all the buffs you get become mildly incomprehensible.  There is also only one real path to victory when there should be several.  If you like civ, then you'll enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995919399', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1483548106}
review:
I loved Clarus Victoria's first game on Steam "Pre-Civilization Marble Age" a lot, as it was a cheap, small game that utterly destroyed you in the beginning. This game is more of the same, but slightly bigger, differently but better done (big improvement imho!) and still destroys you the first time you play it. I've completed my first game in exactly 90 minutes, and got a score of 1/35 ... Yeah, it destroyed me. 

The game plays out in an overhead view where you start as a small tribe of Egyptians (or nomads whatever) as you create and form ancient Egypt. You use food to "purchase" workers who you then allocate to farm, fish, mine, pray, train soldiers or build buildings (you need production for this). As you grow bigger & explore, you meet different tribes who can be aggressive/hostile, neutral or friendly towards you. You can chose to subdue, unite your tribes, trade, etc... You also have some other resources you use to progress in culture and gain additional bonusses for 3 turns.

Just like their previous game, this game is marked in "checkpoint" or events that happen based on how far you've progressed in time. It is up to you to make sure you're ready and get a gold, silver, or bronzen rating (3-2-1 points resp.). You probably won't be prepared for the first time, but that's alright, most events just make you fail and continue the game, unless your tribe gets conquered and subued!

It's a small, highly replayable game for a mere 8 euro's (or 9 when the promotion ended) that I surely will enjoy for many more hours! If you're into (meagre) city building, growing, battling tribes, overcoming difficulties such as floods, sand storms, enemy tribes and the unification of Egypt, and much more, I say give this game a go!

As final remark, I would like to congratiulate Clarus Victoria on this small but fun and great game, which I also haven't encountered any bugs at all in. I like how this company is seemingly always trying to make their games bigger, more fun, dare to change things up a bit and still able to maintain a relative low cost of purchase. Well done Clarus Victoria!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071171483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1481479614}
review:
This game is like a puzzle.  You keep coming back to try that one new strategy.  Food/Production/Army/Culture/Authority.  All five resources that need to be balanced.  And then there's whether you scout new territory or you trade with that city or you attack that city or you join that city.  Then you chose which cult to honor.

There's a lot of strategic choices that add up and then you learn when events happen and how to prepare for them.  Don't be fooled into thinking this is a simple game.  This is like a complex board game with a lot of potential tactical decisions.

It is a little luck dependent.  If you get 1 food/2production square early can definitely shape your progress.  But you can always save/reload scum.

The developer is committed to excellence.

If you want a board game like experience that rewards tactical thinking and makes you keep coming back to try one new strategy buy this game.
